article_title: 2016 election proving the need for a third party
article_text:
Neither party appears to speak to a majority of voters

They don’t understand the degree and nature of our frustration

Here’s what we can build a new party on

article_metadata.news-keywords: Democratic Pary, Republican Party, independent, immigration, federal assistance, PACs
article_metadata.description: In one of the most unusual national elections in memory, many of our basic assumptions about the core principles of the two major political parties don’t seem to apply. For example, a significant proportion of Republicans favor tax increases on the rich. Democrats are similarly confounded – just a few years ago, no Democrat wanted to be known as a “liberal” and had to settle for the softer-sounding “progressive” – yet Bernie Sanders is a viable candidate running as a democratic socialist.
article_metadata.title: 2016 election proving the need for a third party | News & Observer
